Title: June 2009
Content: 3*n34473a0316*turn over   (b) a student carries out a series of tests on a white solid z which contains one cation and one anion.  complete the table below.(6)testobservationinference(i)carry out a flame test on z.red flamecation is eitheror(ii)acidify an aqueous solution of z with dilute nitric acid. then add a few drops of aqueous silver nitrate followed by concentrated aqueous ammonia until there is no further change.cream precipitate whichanion is probably bromide.(iii)add concentrated sulfuric acid to solid z.steamy fumes andvapour seen.probably hydrogen bromide and formed.bromide confirmed.(iv)test the gases formed in (iii) with a piece of filter paper soaked in potassium dichromate(vi) solution.colour change from to sulfur dioxide present. (v) explain, in terms of the redox processes occurring, how sulfur dioxide is produced in (b)(iii).(2) (total for question 1 = 14 marks)
